items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: The Global Story: The deal that broke Ukraine's trust
items.summary: An exploration of the 1994 Budapest Memorandum, intended to enshrine Ukraine's security.

items.title: Cloudburst hits Naugaon area in Uttarkashi; no loss of life so far
items.summary: The cloudburst occurred at Syori Phal Patti in Yamuna Valley in the evening, and sludge from a flooded stream rushed downwards, inflicting damage in low-lying areas

items.title: Caste census: Clamour emerges over how sub castes are classified
items.summary: The listing of sub-castes in alphabetical order, rather than under each caste as one category, has riled many communities

items.title: Morning Digest: Probe into voter fraud in Aland hits a roadblock, ECI yet to share technical data; Sabalenka beats Anisimova to win second straight U.S. Open title, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

items.title: A private broom: Chennai’s conservancy woes
items.summary: For a few weeks now, conservancy workers in Chennai, who had to shift to private operators, have protested against the loss of income and chances of a permanent job. While this issue has sparked a critique of public-private partnership for core civic tasks, the problems of the workers remain unresol

items.title: Britain's Crown Prosecution Service inspects Tihar jail as India intensifies efforts to extradite fugitives
items.summary: According to information, the CPS team visited the high-security ward of Tihar and spoke with the prisoners there

items.title: Five persons booked for running mobile sex determination test unit in Tirupattur
items.summary: All of them were booked under Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act, 1971, by Kurusilapattu police in Tirupattur.

items.title: Youth held for selling painkiller tablets in Vellore
items.summary: Investigations revealed the suspect Vishwa was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area.

items.title: Forest department initiates probe into fire in reserve forest atop Arunachala Hills
items.summary: More than one acre of forest land was gutted in the incident. The hills are home to spotted deer, sloth bear, peacocks, monkeys and Indian gaur.

items.title: Arts and Science college in Vaniyambadi holds Graduation day
items.summary: The executive director of VIT highlighted the importance of women’s empowerment and cited women achievers as examples

items.title: WBSSC to hold examination for teachers recruitment on September 7 amidst high security
items.summary: About 3.19 lakh candidates will take the exam tomorrow for appointment as teachers for class IX and class X in state-run schools. The recruitment on the last occasion in 2016 was riddled with irregularities and corruption

items.title: Boko Haram militants kill 60 in attack in Nigeria's northeast
items.summary: The Bama local government area was the target of several Boko Haram attacks a decade ago, forcing many residents to flee

items.title: Haryana government transfers 20 IAS officers, 1 HCS officer in major reshuffle
items.summary: Munish Sharma, Deputy Commissioner, Charkhi Dadri, has been transferred and posted as Secretary, Haryana Board of School Education, Bhiwani, relieving Munish Nagpal of the charge

items.title: Is a shift underway in India’s foreign policy? | Explained
items.summary: How productive was the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit? Did a meeting between China, Russia and India at Tianjin signal a change in relations? Did U.S. moves on tariffs and sanctions prompt this? What are the leaders saying?

items.title: Mumbai bids grand farewell to ‘Ganpati Bappa’ amid rains, bomb threat; over 18,000 idols immersed
items.summary: According to the BMC, 18,186 Ganapati idols, 1,058 of ‘sarvajanik mandals’ (local community groups) and 258 of Goddess idols, were immersed in natural water bodies and artificial ponds created by the civic body till 9 p.m.

items.title: Thousands bid silent farewell to Giorgio Armani in Milan
items.summary: Early visitors also included Milan Mayor Giuseppe Sala; the city will hold a day of public mourning on September 8

items.title: Rajendra Arlekar | Saffron guard
items.summary: The Kerala Governor, a former functionary of the BJP, faces criticism for ‘saffronising’ education and violating constitutional propriety

items.title: Sabalenka keeps cool to retain US Open title
items.summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka lands a first major of the year after seeing off home hope Amanda Anisimova to retain her US Open title.

items.title: Katchatheevu | A flashpoint in the Palk Strait
items.summary: Half a century since New Delhi gave up its claim to the barren island and recognised Sri Lanka’s sovereignty over it, politicians in India periodically rake up the issue, triggering tensions in ties between the friendly countries

items.title: BCCI adds ₹14,627 crore in five years, ₹4,193 crore in last financial year: Report
items.summary: Aided by IPL earnings and ICC distributions, the BCCI posted a surplus of ₹1,623.08 crore for 2023-24, up from ₹1,167.99 crore in the previous year, according to the report

items.title: Maharashtra’s anganwadi centres find few takers for protein powder, premixed khichdi
Delhi riots: Sharjeel Imam moves Supreme Court after High Court rejects bail plea
Relief eludes thousands in camps despite receding Yamuna levels
items.summary: Over 12,000 displaced residents struggle as sanitation and food distribution remain inadequate in relief camps; children miss classes as schools remain shut; reptiles displaced by floodwaters enter homes, offices, and metro stations, sparking fear

items.title: Cyber Crime Wing probes the involvement of Chinese network in cyber frauds through SIM Boxes
items.summary: Cyber crime syndicates are setting up SIM box networks to bypass gateways put in place by telecom department and other service providers to reduce calls from foreign and spoofed local numbers; fraudsters are roping in local residents promising a ‘commission’

items.title: Forest watcher injured in wild elephant attack near Athirappilly
Man stabbed in bar
DUSU polls: HC seeks DU response on ₹1-lakh surety clause
Delhi CM announces 1200 units of free power for Ramlila events
Delhi records 163 clean air days
Bengaluru court convicts woman for murdering 6-year-old nephew
Gold ornaments worth ₹1.5 crore stolen from Jain event held at Red Fort; accused at large
KL University ranked 26th nationally in NIRF rankings
CEITA urges Centre to reduce GST on electronics to protect domestic trade
T.N. Health Minister flags air travelers’ woes, seeks Airbus services on key routes
items.summary: Mr.Subramanian highlighted that, in recent times, passengers flying to Madurai from Chennai airport have been experiencing severe mental stress due to inadequate seating in shuttle buses

items.title: Reform UK's new faces seek to share spotlight with Farage
items.summary: The party is keen to get away from the idea that it is a one-man-band, focused too much on its leader Nigel Farage.

items.title: Bengaluru road-rage: Man arrested for attempting to assault autorickshaw driver
Market ructions and cabinet reshuffles will help shape Reeves' Budget
items.summary: OBR spreadsheets, bond markets, and backbench unhappiness on cuts will all influence the chancellor's thinking.

items.title: 'When I left the military I felt quite alone': Female veterans call for more support
items.summary: Dr Bex Bennett co-founded Sisters in Service, which has now recruited 160 members across the UK.

items.title: One of the most sacred places in the world is being turned into a luxury mega-resort
items.summary: Luxury hotels, villas and bazaars are being built at the revered biblical site, which is home to Bedouins.

items.title: Inflatable tanks and flat-pack guns - inside Ukraine's decoy war
items.summary: Both Russia and Ukraine are using blow up dolls and plastic decoys as tricks on the battlefield.

items.title: Youth nabbed for stabbing girl
Police Day celebrated in Tamil Nadu for the first time
Chennai Corporation completes 12 bridges in four years
Chennai is my best friend: Kanimozhi Karunanidhi
Chennai Mayor flags off improvement work on 22 waterbodies
Entries open Tamil feature film competition
Residents complain about sinking manholes that pose a hazard to motorists along GCC roads
Sankara Nethralaya holds ‘Walk for Vision 2025’ to mark national eye donation day
Police Commissioner inaugurates guidance programme
‘Mavelicuz 2025’ to draw to a close in Kozhikode
Carlo Acutis: From a baptism in London to the first millennial saint
items.summary: Before his death at 15, Carlo Acutis was known for his love of technology and had created a website to document miracles.

items.title: Opposition parties criticise DMK government for deterioration of law and order situation in T.N.
items.summary: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami says the Chief Minister M.K. Stalin-led government has failed to maintain law and order and DMK functionaries being involved in criminal activities has become a regular occurrence

items.title: Anna Wintour was Vogue. Now she's gone, can the magazine stay relevant?
items.summary: She made a name for herself as someone who understood the zeitgeist. But her successor Chloe Malle faces an uphill battle.

items.title: Tamil Nadu government introduces overseas scholarship for Muslim students
items.summary: The scholarship will assist their higher studies if they are admitted to institutions ranked within the top 250 in the Global QS rankings

items.title: Election Commission risks losing credibility, warns SC advocate Sanjay Hegde
Charity visit on the cards as Harry returns to UK
items.summary: It is one of several engagements for the Duke of Sussex during his visit to the UK this week.

items.title: Probe begins into rally with Palestine’s national flag in Kakinada
Police constable arrested on rape charges
Rights reform to 'head off Farage' and 'EastEnders Jamie axed'
items.summary: The fallout from Angela Rayner's resignation and the axing of EastEnders star Jamie Borthwick lead Sunday's papers.

items.title: How will the EU's new border system work?
items.summary: The EU's much-delayed Entry/Exit System will change the way UK passengers travel to 29 countries.

items.title: HC grants bail to three persons accused in Madurai property tax scam
J&K parties seek removal of Waqf chairperson Darakshan Andrabi over ‘National Emblem plaque’ row
items.summary: Chairperson placing a plaque with the National Emblem at the shrine sparks protests; BJP, Shiv Sena demand action against those who vandalised plaque

items.title: AIMIM to support Justice Sudershan Reddy as VP candidate
‘Seven years after decriminalisation of homosexuality, little has changed’
Dharmasthala case: Complainant remanded in judicial custody for 14 days, taken to Shivamogga jail
Kavitha vows to continue fight for 42% quota; BC leaders join Telangana Jagruthi
Parts of Thiruvengadam Street in disarray
items.summary: Half of the road has been rendered unmotorable, and during rush hour, the traffic is a deluge seeking to escape through a narrow nozzle

items.title: Science-based problem-solving should take an inclusive approach, says academic
items.summary: Given the lack of adequate scientists and doctors across the globe, he points out that the role of community health workers was paramount and their access to right set of tools critical

items.title: A teacher and road safety campaigner rolled into one
items.summary: On September 5, S. Mala, a Velachery resident and a teacher with Children’s Garden Higher Secondary School in Mylapore, received Vidhya Seva Samman Award for her work in the classroom growing lives and on the road saving them

items.title: Man found dead with head injury in Perumbavoor
Dinner gatherings at PM, BJP chief’s residences cancelled over floods in Punjab and other regions
items.summary: While Friday brought some respite from the relentless rain, several northern Indian States grapple with the destruction left behind by the monsoon in the most affected areas

items.title: Supreme Court panel on students’ mental health gets State Nodal Officers; over 1 lakh survey responses received
items.summary: The 12-member National Task Force was formed after parents of students who had died by suicide in higher education campuses had sought relief from the Supreme Court

items.title: SHRC begins inquiry against police for illegal detention of woman, three children
Dickson denies Bears to steer Somerset to Finals Day
items.summary: Sean Dickson hits two sixes and a four to lead Somerset to a final-over victory over Bears to qualify for T20 Blast Finals Day.

items.title: Commissioners of corporations lead cleaniness operations, encroachment clearance across Bengaluru
Ripon Building, Chennai Central find ‘new addresses’
items.summary: Each of the 15 zones within GCC limits can decide on the designs for the view cutters to be installed around power transformers, say officials

items.title: Karnataka’s fertility rate declines further to 1.5, well below replacement level
Declining budget for MGNREGS means reduced income for women in rural India, say activists
items.summary: Given the Finance Ministry’s directive capping the expenditure in the first two quarters at 60% of the total available budget, the Centre has only ₹79 crore under the programme for the month of September

items.title: A thorough probe will be launched into irregularities, scams reported in Corporations, says Edappadi K. Palaniswami
Pugazhendhi criticises EPS for removing Sengottaiyan from party posts
Shortage of laterite stones: BJP to stage dharna in Mangaluru on Sept. 16
Duty to Constitution lies with every lawyer, not just people in power corridors, says Justice Nagarathna
items.summary: In a convocation address, the senior apex court judge exhorted law graduates to use their knowledge and skills to build inclusive institutions and promote systemic equity, becoming ‘true custodians of the rule of law’

items.title: West Bengal Minister surrenders before court, gets bail in teacher recruitment case
items.summary: Chandranath Sinha is the second Minister in the Cabinet to be booked in the recruitment scam

items.title: Nainar Nagendran did not handle alliance efficiently, says Dhinakaran
Ganesh immersion in Hyderabad continues peacefully
Attempt at self-harm averted with timely intervention
Minister launches 27 projects worth ₹41 crore in Ramanathapuram
Process has become punishment in criminal justice delivery: ex-CJI N.V. Ramana
items.summary: At Lexposium 2025, organised by the SRM School of Law in association with The Hindu, the retired judge listed several factors that erode public trust on the judiciary, including pendency of cases and high costs of litigation

items.title: Youth hacked to death in Manamadurai
Dozens detained at Serbia anti-government rally: Minister
items.summary: Several thousand people rallied in Novi Sad late Friday seeking early elections in the latest in a series of student-led protests across Serbia sparked by the fatal collapse of the northern city's train station roof last November

items.title: Remarks linking Dharmasthala: T.N. MP files defamation case against Karnataka BJP MLA
Hungary police ban Pride parade amid LGBTQ crackdown
items.summary: They justified the move by citing amendments to laws and the constitution this year that make it illegal to hold an Assembly promoting homosexuality

items.title: Reform criticised over doctor's Covid jab claims at conference
items.summary: A speaker at the Reform UK conference claimed it was "highly likely" that the jab was linked to the King and Princess of Wales' cancers.

items.title: MSMEs in Coimbatore demand reduction in GST
Man booked for inflammatory post on cattle theft
China criticises Australia, Canada warships in Taiwan Strait
items.summary: (Chinese) troops remain on high alert at all times, resolutely safeguarding national sovereignty and security and regional peace and stability, says Senior Colonel Shi Yi

items.title: Raw material exhibition in Coimbatore from September 11 to 13
Venezuela's Maduro urges dialogue after Trump threat
items.summary: Tensions between the two countries soared in recent days after the Pentagon accused Venezuela of buzzing its ships in the Caribbean following a deadly U.S. strike on an alleged Venezuelan drug boat

items.title: Police officers involved in Kunnamkulam custodial torture suspended
items.summary: Police surveillance camera footage of the torture, procured through an uphill RTI litigation by the victim, a Youth Congress leader, had led to public outrage. Congress workers march to the residences of the suspended officers
